channel.title: **<Noob friendly Sprite editing guide>**
channel.description:
*Noob friendly guide* Editing The 4d RSC ;)
1. Download Sprite editor http://www.4shared.com/file/99749127/e3309869/RSCD_Sprite_Editor.html 2. click Run_editor 3. Click Unpack Now you have all the orginal sprites from rsc in the Sprite folder.
1. Take The Sprite.rscd from Your client and past it in the Editor folder. 2. Press unpack_sprite 3. Select sprite.rscd and press OK (Let it unpack don't close the CMD) Now you have the sprite from YOUR client in the unpacked folder.
Pack an certein item: 1. Go to Sprite_editor/unpacked(Or Sprites)/img And select your item/picture 2. Edit it 3. Save it in some easy place, like the sprite_editor folder. Save as and .PNG format. 4. Open Run_Editor 5. Add picture 6. Save as the same number of what you edit with .spr in the end. (Exemple: 3150.spr) 7. Take the (3150.spr) and put it into the Sprite folder. OBS Don't put it into Sprite/img or sprite/sprite. 8. Go back and press pack_sprites, Select .rscd and hit OK Now you are official done, take the sprite.rscd back to the client and watch your fine fine work.
Info: To edit Items/objects and some other stuff you will need to set the right value, weight etc. Finding out the right value and other stuff on items and more. Take and .spr file that you didn't make open it with sprite_editor. (SEE THE PICTURE) [IMG]http://i274.photobucket.com/albums/jj267/uberpker/namnls.jpg[/img] Now you know the value for half a shield, write them down or take a [u]PRT SCR[/u]! Now if you take the image of the shield you open it with the editor and set the right stuff down there, once again SEE THE PICTURE!
When you done and befor you save press refresh then save as .spr!
Oh and don't forget to write TRUE on shift;)

darscape:

Ought to talk about shifting for menu sprites and explain about the various angles for the ‘3d’ sprites to give this a more complete tutorial on sprites in general for the newbies.

I didn’t make this because i wanted to explain stuff, just heard to many questions about sprites and non of them was answer.
Beside if you do it this way i said here it should work without problems.

Read full topic

item.title: **<Noob friendly Sprite editing guide>**
item.dc:creator: @snoopy89 snoopy89
item.description:
@snoopy89 wrote:

Noob friendly guide
Editing The 4d RSC

  1. Download Sprite editor http://www.4shared.com/file/99749127/e3309869/RSCD_Sprite_Editor.html

  2. click Run_editor

  3. Click Unpack
    Now you have all the orginal sprites from rsc in the Sprite folder.

  4. Take The Sprite.rscd from Your client and past it in the Editor folder.

  5. Press unpack_sprite

  6. Select sprite.rscd and press OK (Let it unpack don’t close the CMD)
    Now you have the sprite from YOUR client in the unpacked folder.

Pack an certein item:

  1. Go to Sprite_editor/unpacked(Or Sprites)/img And select your item/picture
  2. Edit it
  3. Save it in some easy place, like the sprite_editor folder. Save as and .PNG format.
  4. Open Run_Editor
  5. Add picture
  6. Save as the same number of what you edit with .spr in the end. (Exemple: 3150.spr)
  7. Take the (3150.spr) and put it into the Sprite folder. OBS Don’t put it into Sprite/img or sprite/sprite.
  8. Go back and press pack_sprites, Select .rscd and hit OK
    Now you are official done, take the sprite.rscd back to the client and watch your fine fine work.

Info:
To edit Items/objects and some other stuff you will need to set the right value, weight etc.
Finding out the right value and other stuff on items and more.
Take and .spr file that you didn’t make open it with sprite_editor. (SEE THE PICTURE)

namnls.jpg778×397

Now you know the value for half a shield, write them down or take a PRT SCR!
Now if you take the image of the shield you open it with the editor and set the right stuff down there, once again SEE THE PICTURE!

When you done and befor you save press refresh then save as .spr!

Oh and don’t forget to write TRUE on shift;)

Read full topic
